model.mediator

Class RmiServer

  • java.lang.Object
    • model.mediator.RmiServer
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.rmi.Remote, RemoteServer

    public class RmiServer
extends java.lang.Object
implements RemoteServer
    RMI Server object implementation, implementing the RemoteServer interface which extends the Remote interface. Contains logic used in the finalization of the processes run on the Server side.
    Version:
    1.5
    Author:
    Group 4
    See Also:
    Remote

      Constructor of yhe RMI Server object.

    • Constructor Detail

      • RmiServer

        public RmiServer()
          throws java.rmi.RemoteException,
                 java.net.MalformedURLException
        Constructor of yhe RMI Server object. In the constructor a registry is started that would allow multiple Stub instances to connect to a single remote space. A ModelServer is created.
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException
        java.net.MalformedURLException
        See Also:
        startRegistery(), startServer()

    • Method Detail

      • startRegistery

        public void startRegistery()
                    throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        Method starting a local registry on the computer running the program. In case a local registery is already created the method will not perfom anything.
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException

      • startServer

        public void startServer()
                 throws java.rmi.RemoteException,
                        java.net.MalformedURLException
        Method exporting the RMI Server entity to the the created registery. The object is binded through naming meaning only instances that will connect to the "Library" stubs will be granted access to the remote functions.
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException
        java.net.MalformedURLException
        See Also:
        Naming

      • registerNewUser

        public void registerNewUser(Student newStudent,
                            Book book,
                            RemoteClient rmiClient)
                     throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        Registers a new user with the mandatory book as his/her first element of its bookList. Multiple conditions are checked with the ModelServer to see if the registration is possible or not. If the conditions are met the client will adopt the new User as localUser. In the contrary case no changes will be made.
        Specified by:
        registerNewUser in interface RemoteServer
        Parameters:
        newStudent -
        book -
        rmiClient -
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException
        See Also:
        ModelManagerServer.verifyIfUserIsUnique(Student), ModelManagerServer.registerUser(Student, Book), ModelManagerServer.registerNewOnlineUser(Student, RemoteClient), ModelManagerServer.getBookListOfUser(Student)

      • logIn

        public void logIn(Student student,
                  RemoteClient rmiClient)
           throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        Logs in one already existing user as an online user. Certain conditions are checked to see if the login can be made or not. In favorable case the client will receive the server's information related to te user that he wants to be logged in as. If not the client receives the error message and not changes will be done.
        Specified by:
        logIn in interface RemoteServer
        Parameters:
        student -
        rmiClient -
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException
        See Also:
        ModelManagerServer.verifyIfUserExists(Student), ModelManagerServer.verifyIfUserIsOnline(Student), ModelManagerServer.getRequestListAsBorrower(Student), ModelManagerServer.getRequestListasOwner(Student)

      • logOff

        public void logOff(Student localUser,
                   RemoteClient rmiClient)
            throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        Removes one online user from the system. This will apply no changes to the user itself, the Student representing that user. A user that logs off will not be able to receive live notifications or access data modification methods.
        Specified by:
        logOff in interface RemoteServer
        Parameters:
        localUser -
        rmiClient -
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException
        See Also:
        ModelManagerServer.removeOnlineUser(Student)

      • registerNewBook

        public void registerNewBook(Book book,
                            RemoteClient rmiClient)
        Adds a new Book to a specific Student in the system. The student for with tha book needs to be added is provided as the owner of the book already from the Client side.
        Specified by:
        registerNewBook in interface RemoteServer

      • removeBook

        public void removeBook(Book book,
                       RemoteClient rmiClient)
                throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        Removes a book from a specific Student's BookList. The student is provided as the owner of the Book. A book can be removed only is it is available.
        Specified by:
        removeBook in interface RemoteServer
        Parameters:

        rmiClient -

      • search

        public void search(java.lang.String category,
                   java.lang.String input,
                   RemoteClient rmiClient)
            throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        Searches for matching results with the Library' s data depending on the category chosen and input. The category can be either "title" or "author".

      • atemptBorrow

        public void atemptBorrow(Request request,
                         RemoteClient rmiClient)
        Adds a Request object in the system's data if the conditions are met. To request a book, the book must be available, not owned by the person who is requesting it and the sytem must not have already pending Request on the specific book. If the conditions are met and the owner of the book requested is online it receives the request after its being added to the server's data.
        Specified by:
        atemptBorrow in interface RemoteServer
        Parameters:
        request -
        rmiClient -
        See Also:
        ModelManagerServer.bookHasRequest(Book), ModelManagerServer.addRequest(Request)

      • receiveAnswerToRequest

        public void receiveAnswerToRequest(Request request,
                                   RemoteClient rmiClient)
                            throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        Handles the answer of one user to one specific request. In the case of an accepted Request a borrow between the owner of the requested book and the user requesting that book. In case of a denied request there will be no changes to the system information. If the Student who requested the book is online it will receive the aswer to the request. Else the system will save the modified request.
        Specified by:
        receiveAnswerToRequest in interface RemoteServer
        Parameters:
        request -
        rmiClient -
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException
        See Also:
        ModelManagerServer.verifyIfUserIsOnline(Student), ModelManagerServer.getAssociatedClient(Student), ModelManagerServer.changeRequestForAnswer(Request), ModelManagerServer.borrow(Student, Book)
